text: hi everyone I'm Lindsay strand today I'm
speak up we're making baked TRO now I
know what you may be thinking
traditional churros are fried
but our version with just four
ingredients is the easiest way to make
sure of at home they're a great
alternative for anyone that doesn't want
to use a lot of oil or fry in their
kitchen which can get pretty messy so
I've started by preheating my oven to
425 and next I'll make my sugar mixture
that we use to toss the churros so this
is just 1/2 cup of granulated sugar and
2 teaspoons of cinnamon gonna give that
a whisk we're going to dust the churros
in this when they come out hot from the
oven
next we'll roll out our puff pastry so
here I have 14 ounces of all butter puff
pastry I like to use all butter because
it has the best flavor so we'll roll
this out to a 12 by 16 rectangle let's
see we're starting at 15 by 10 I'll just
roll it out a little bit more I'm going
to put a little flour on top and if you
use vegetable shortening puff pastry
that's totally fine but you're going to
want to check the box because every
brand has a different oven setting and I
solved this out they come frozen so this
is still a little bit chilled so it's
easy to work with it's nice and pliable
so see where we're at
16:12 perfect next we'll make an egg
wash to brush over the dough this is
going to help seal the churros together
when we twist them so just take an egg
beat it lightly good then we're going to
brush it all over the top of the pastry
dough
[Music]
get all the way to the edges here so
that it heals together next we're going
to fold the top half over the bottom
half and then press all of the air
bubbles out so it really sticks to
itself here now we're going to cut this
into 32 strips we want them to be about
1/2 inch thick you can either use a
ruler or you could cut it in half then
in quarters then again and again until
you get 32 so I'm going to use a pizza
cutter you could also use a paring knife
or any sharp knife you have at home but
I think this makes it really easy to cut
into strips so this looks like about 1/2
inch and I'm just going to eyeball it
[Music]
just like that now that we have our
strips we're going to take them and you
just give them a twist like this we're
going to put it onto a baking sheet if
you press the ends onto the baking sheet
like this that really helps them stick
so when you put them in the freezer
they'll maintain their shape really
nicely
[Music]
since this trades done I'm going to go
pop it in the freezer for 30 minutes and
show their firm that's going to help
them keep their nice spiral shape all
their baking and they'll get going on my
next string
so we'll bake these until they're puffs
in golden 22:22
while my Tros are baking I'm going to
make the Mexican chocolate sauce that
goes with the churros so it's basically
a ganache it's super simple
it's 1 cup of heavy cream that we're
going to heat to a simmer while this
heat I'll chop 8 ounces of bittersweet
chocolate I like to the serrated knife
of this it makes it a lot less messy to
chop your chocolate I kind of lay them
out like this I'll go through once to
play and then I'll go back once the
other way I'll find enough chopped so
that the chocolate melts really nicely
into the cream we're going to put this
into a heat proof Bowl so that when we
pour the cream over it'll melt the
chocolate check on our cream is bubbling
here around the edges we just want it
scalding we don't want it to really boil
too much so that looks pretty good I'll
pour the hot cream over that should be
just enough to melt the chocolate I'm
going to let this sit for five minutes
so it can really melt the chocolate and
then when we stir it it will be
perfectly smooth spin 5 minutes so I'm
ready to stir my lovely ganache it will
slowly start coming together it's like
the magic of chocolate and cream
[Music]
and we have a silky shiny lovely
chocolate sauce so now to make this
really have the flavors of Mexican hot
chocolate I'll add half a teaspoon of
ground cinnamon 1/2 a teaspoon of ancho
chili powder and 1/2 teaspoon of pure
vanilla extract you don't have to add
these flavors if you don't want to but I
think that the spices in the vanilla
plays really nicely with the dark
chocolate and make it a really rich
delicious
a little bit spicy sauce so I'll set
this aside until our trim out of Yemen
I've just pulled my Cheerios out of the

still a little bit hot
you want to take them and put them into

is you do want to do this well they're a

the outside of the Trobe look how good

chocolate mixture in here wow that looks

a little messy but so worth it
